tasks.task: Visit and observe a corn processing plant.
subtasks: Meet Bob Garst and Charlie Thomas.
View a field of open-pollinated corn.
Compare it to a field of Pioneer Hybrid corn.
Examine hybrid corn stalks and ears.
Pull a corn stalk to demonstrate its strength.
Inspect roots of open-pollinated and hybrid corn.
Operate a mechanical corn picker.
Witness corn being loaded and transported.
Observe the sorting and grading process.
Learn about the replanting agreement.

tasks.task: Attend a corn processing facility tour.
subtasks: Conduct a field comparison of open-pollinated vs hybrid corn.
Operate a corn picker machine.
Assist in moving corn to processing plant.
Sort and grade corn kernels.

tasks.task: Learn about hybrid corn cultivation techniques.
subtasks: Observe corn breeding and selection processes.
Understand the importance of uniform ear height.
Appreciate the role of root systems in stalk strength.
Recognize the benefits of mechanical harvesting.

tasks.task: Perform tasks related to corn processing.
subtasks: Inspect and reject inferior ears.
Use conveyor belts for corn sorting.
Operate dryers for corn moisture reduction.
Handle hot air drying processes.
Shell corn kernels efficiently.
Grader different kernel sizes.
Apply mercury treatment to seeds.

tasks.task: Learn about the Pioneer Hybrid seed distribution.
subtasks: Store processed seeds in warehouses.
Understand the replanting agreement benefits.
Calculate financial advantages of Pioneer corn.
